sampleDescription: Backscattered electron (BSE) SEM images of a platinum-infiltrated NMC cathode (to reduce the 'pore-back' effect). Two detectors were used, the “concentric back-scattered” (CBS) and the through-lens detector (TLD).
citations: S. J. Cooper et al, 'Methods—Kintsugi Imaging of Battery Electrodes: Distinguishing Pores from the Carbon Binder Domain using Pt Deposition', J. Electrochem. Soc. 169 070512, (2022)
R. Docherty et al, 'Battery Imaging Library: Democratising multi-length scale and multi-modal synchrotron and laboratory battery imaging data', arXiv preprint

sampleDescription: Energy Dispersive Spectroscopy (EDS) elemental maps of a platinum-infiltrated NMC cathode (to reduce the 'pore-back' effect). The channels are Ni (Active Material), Al (Current collector), Pt (Pore), C (Carbon Binder), F.
instrument: Thermo Scientific Helios Hydra PFIB-SEM (Oxford Instruments X-Max 50 silicon drift detector)
citations: S. J. Cooper et al, 'Methods—Kintsugi Imaging of Battery Electrodes: Distinguishing Pores from the Carbon Binder Domain using Pt Deposition', J. Electrochem. Soc. 169 070512, (2022)
R. Docherty et al, 'Battery Imaging Library: Democratising multi-length scale and multi-modal synchrotron and laboratory battery imaging data', arXiv preprint

citations: R. Docherty et al, 'Battery Imaging Library: Democratising multi-length scale and multi-modal synchrotron and laboratory battery imaging data', arXiv preprint
